text:
Please modify the default mime.types ant httpd.conf as discussed in Bug #31483
(for Apache1.3).

1. in httpd.conf, change
#AddEncoding x-gzip .gz .tgz
to
AddEncoding x-gzip .gz .tgz .svgz

2. in mime.types, change
image/svg+xml			svg
to
image/svg+xml			svg svgz
creator: richard.beton@roke.co.uk
chip@force-elite.com
text: Let admins configure this. The AddEncoding line isn't even present in 2.2.0.

I don't understand the justification for this. Doesn't the out-of-the-box
configuration reflect 'normal' default practice? Gzip compression of SVG will
probably be widely used given the typical large file sizes of SVG.
creator: richard.beton@roke.co.uk
